A group called Standing Together has a phone line. People who are being bothered can call them. This helps both Jewish and Palestinian people.

A study showed that many Arab citizens of Israel are afraid. About 60% are afraid of being bothered. 10% have been bothered before.

Daood said that this is bad for Israel. He said that people are in pain and scared since October 7. He thinks that people are losing their kindness.

He also said that they have had bad times before. But they always find a way to get better. They want to show that there is another way to live together.

Vera Deek is an Arab Christian. She used to be a teacher. She watched children making puppets in Jaffa. She said they believe in living together in peace. That is why she brought her daughter.

She said that the problem is not with the children. It is hard to live a normal life. So many people have died or are still dying.

Many Arab citizens of Israel lost friends and family. Some died in Gaza. Some died in the attacks on October 7.

Four people died when a rocket from Gaza hit a village. This village was in the Negev desert.

Some Arab citizens of Israel helped after the attacks. They were paramedics. Some of them were killed by Hamas.

The Bedouin tribes in the Negev helped a lot. They looked for missing Israelis. They were some of the first to help.

text: As she spoke, Deek jumped at the sounds of a construction site – similar to the booms of the anti-rocket batteries in action only a few minutes before – then explained that she was worried about her son, who was playing football in a nearby park. “Arabs and Jews must live together,” Deek said. “Ordinary people are not the problem.”
a2_text: Deek was talking. Then, she heard a loud noise. It was like the rockets from before. But it was just a building site. Deek said she was worried. Her son was playing football. He was in a park near here. Deek said, "Arabs and Jews must live together." She also said, "Normal people are not the problem."

text: There was a familiar sense of misery for many travellers in the week before Christmas as hundreds of trains were cancelled, motorways were closed and ferry passengers queued for miles waiting to board their ships. But it doesn’t have to be this way, transport campaigners say, as politicians and transport bosses have the power to ease some of the problems facing travellers. There is more gloom to come in the short term, according to the RAC, with Boxing Day traffic surging, and the prospect of dangerous winds in Scotland and northern England. Around 21 million people drove to visit family or friends before Christmas, and thousands more took flights or trains as what has become known as the great Christmas getaway gained momentum. Storm Pia caused disruption to rail and road in Scotland and northern England on Wednesday. Eurostar workers in France took industrial action the following day, and the knock-on effect was huge demand for ferry services. Motorists queued for 90 minutes during peak times. Saturday was expected to be the busiest day of the year on the roads, according to the RAC and Inrix, with 20% more car journeys than last Christmas weekend. On Boxing Day they expect drivers on the M25 to face 50-minute delays, and on 27 December journeys in busy areas of the UK will be 25% longer. On Saturday Port of Dover Travel reported a 90-minute wait at French border controls as traffic built up after a surge in ferry bookings in the wake of Thursday’s Eurotunnel disruption. And the Met Office is warning of high winds in Scotland, northern England and north Wales today, with possible power cuts and flying debris. Even though the weather may be out of the control of ministers and rail chiefs, they have other ways of easing the burden on travellers, according to the Campaign for Better Transport (CBT) and the Clean Cities Campaign (CCC). National Highways removed 1,000 miles of roadworks on 19 December – “an early Christmas present” for drivers during the festive getaway. They will be back on 2 January. Widespread engineering works are planned for the rail network, although Network Rail said it was carrying out less work than usual, and no trains run on Christmas Day. In London, Paddington station is shut until Wednesday for HS2 works, while King’s Cross is shut today and Victoria station is not running Southeastern services until 2 January.
a2_text:
Many people were sad before Christmas. Many trains were stopped. Some roads were closed. People waited a long time for their boats.

Some people who work with transport say it does not need to be like this. They say that people in charge can help.

The RAC says things will be bad soon. There will be a lot of cars on the road after Christmas. There may be strong winds in Scotland and England.

About 21 million people drove to see family before Christmas. Many other people took planes or trains. This is called the Christmas getaway.

Storm Pia caused problems for trains and roads in Scotland and England. Workers in France stopped working on Thursday. This made more people want to take boats.

People waited 90 minutes in their cars. Saturday was supposed to be the busiest day for cars. There were 20% more cars than last Christmas.

The RAC says that on Boxing Day, drivers on the M25 road will wait 50 minutes. On 27 December, trips in busy places will take 25% longer.

On Saturday, people waited 90 minutes at the border in France. This was because more people wanted to take boats after the train problems on Thursday.

The weather office says there will be strong winds in Scotland, England, and Wales. There may be no power and things may fly in the wind.

The weather is not the fault of the people in charge. But they can still help travelers. This is what the Campaign for Better Transport and the Clean Cities Campaign say.

National Highways took away 1,000 miles of road work on 19 December. They said it was a gift for drivers. But the road work will start again on 2 January.

There will be a lot of work on the trains. But Network Rail says they are doing less work than normal. There are no trains on Christmas Day.

Paddington station in London is closed until Wednesday. This is because of HS2 work. King’s Cross is closed today. Victoria station will not have Southeastern trains until 2 January.

text: And passengers will be gambling with services by operators such as Avanti West Coast, which cut services in December and has seen 32% of services cancelled or severely delayed. “It doesn’t have to be this way,” said Michael Solomon Williams, CBT campaigns manager. “It’s not rational any more to distinguish between commuter travel and leisure travel.” Since the pandemic, fewer people travel during the week, he said. “People work weekends, go to football matches. There are all sorts of reasons why we need more services at weekends and Christmas, when people travel around the country more than any other time. “Another time makes more sense, like the second week of January, or on a Monday, for example.” He added that another balm for travellers would be the creation of Great British Railways, announced by the government in May 2021 but mothballed in October 2022. And passengers are being told to pay an extra 4.9% on rail fares in the new year. “They could have frozen fares the way they have with fuel duty for the last 13 years,” Solomon Williams said. “The cost of travelling by train has gone up at twice the rate of driving.” Oliver Lord, head of CCC, said that disrupting services on the busiest travel days of the year meant people were more likely to choose to take the car, adding to congestion. “A third of rail use now is on leisure,” he said. “If the three or four times a year a family wants to use trains to get out of town, and their experience is engineering works, a rail replacement bus service and journeys that take three times as long, what will they think? “It’s a great opportunity for the government to make a strategic decision,” Lord added. “If we said the first week or two of January was a time when businesses and corporations could do things a bit differently, with more working from home, that would be a great new year’s resolution from the government.” Travellers who have faced cancellations or delays should make sure they claim compensation, said Naomi Leach, deputy editor of Which? Travel. “Sadly, it seems as though serious travel disruption over the festive period is becoming increasingly commonplace, with travellers once again facing the misery of cancelled trains as they try to make it home in time for Christmas,” she said.
a2_text:
People who use trains might have problems. The train company, Avanti West Coast, had fewer trains in December. Many of their trains were late or cancelled.

Michael Solomon Williams works for CBT. He said this is not good. He thinks we should not only think about people who travel to work.

He said that fewer people travel to work now since the pandemic. The pandemic is when the virus made many people sick. Now, people also travel on weekends. They go to football games. People travel a lot at Christmas time. We need more trains then. January is a better time to do train repairs, or maybe Mondays.

He also said that Great British Railways would help. The government said they would make it in 2021. But they stopped working on it in 2022.

Train tickets will cost 4.9% more next year. Michael Solomon Williams said the government could have kept the prices the same. They do this with fuel for cars. Train tickets cost much more than driving a car.

Oliver Lord is the head of CCC. He said that if trains stop running when people want to travel, they will use their cars. This will make more traffic.

He said that many people use trains for fun now. Families want to use trains to go on trips. But if the trains are not working, or they need to take a bus, they will not like it. The trips will take too long.

Oliver Lord thinks the government can do something. He said that businesses could let people work from home in January. This would help people travel easier.

Naomi Leach works for Which? Travel. She said that if your train is late or cancelled, you should ask for money back. She said that trains are often cancelled at Christmas. People want to go home for Christmas, but it is difficult.

text: “If your train is cancelled or delayed, make sure you make a note of your ticket number and register a claim via Delay Repay, a nationwide scheme to compensate rail passengers for delays of 15 minutes or more. “The Eurostar operates its own compensation scheme for delays of an hour or more which accepts claims from 24 hours after the disruption took place.”
a2_text:
Okay, here is the rewritten text at CEFR A2 level:

If your train does not come, or if it is late, remember your ticket number. Write it down. You can get money back. This is called Delay Repay. It is for all train travelers in the country. If your train is 15 minutes late or more, you can ask for money back.

The Eurostar train also gives money back if it is late. But for Eurostar, the train must be late for one hour or more. You can ask for money back one day after the train was late.

text: A person has died in Scotland after falling ill with E coli, in what appears to be the first death linked to an outbreak that has affected at least 30 people. The UK Health Security Agency said the death “has been associated with this outbreak” and added later that it occurred in Scotland, but was unable to provide more information about the case. The agency said that as of 27 December there had been 30 confirmed cases in England and Scotland linked to an outbreak of Shiga toxin-producing E coli (Stec), which first emerged in July. The cases involved children as young as seven and those aged up to 81, and most cases had occurred in December. The Food Standards Agency (FSA) and Food Standards Scotland announced a precautionary recall of four cheeses made by Mrs Kirkham’s Lancashire Cheese on Christmas Eve due to possible E coli contamination. It added a fifth product, which is sold by Waitrose, to the recall list on 27 December. “Epidemiological and food chain investigations have identified links between some of the identified cases and a number of unpasteurised cheeses produced by a business in England,” the agency said. “UKHSA is continuing to follow up cases to identify any common links, including determining whether cases ate or came into contact with the recalled cheeses.” The products affected by the recall are: Mrs Kirkham’s Mild & Creamy Lancashire; Mrs Kirkham’s Tasty Lancashire; Mrs Kirkham’s Mature Lancashire; Mrs Kirkham’s Smoked Lancashire; and No 1 Waitrose and Partners, Farmhouse Kirkham’s Lancashire cheese. Amy Douglas, the agency’s incident director for gastrointestinal infections and food safety division, urged people who suspected they may have been infected not to travel over the holiday season. “There have been at least 30 confirmed cases of this specific outbreak strain of Stec in the UK,” she said. “Symptoms of Stec include severe diarrhoea (including bloody diarrhoea), stomach cramps, vomiting and fever. If you have diarrhoea and vomiting, you can take steps to avoid passing it on to family and friends over the festive period.
a2_text:
Someone has died in Scotland. They were sick with E coli. This seems to be the first death from an E coli problem. About 30 people are sick.

The UK Health Security Agency said the death is connected to the E coli problem. It happened in Scotland. They cannot give more details about the person.

The agency said that 30 people in England and Scotland have E coli. This started in July. The E coli is called Shiga toxin-producing E coli (Stec).

Children and older people are sick. Some children are seven years old. Some people are 81 years old. Most people got sick in December.

The Food Standards Agency (FSA) and Food Standards Scotland said something. Some cheeses might have E coli. These cheeses are made by Mrs Kirkham’s Lancashire Cheese. They told people to not eat these cheeses on Christmas Eve.

Later, they added another cheese to the list. This cheese is sold at Waitrose. People should not eat it either.

The agency looked at the food and the people who are sick. They found a link between some people and some cheeses. The cheeses are made in England. They are not heated to kill germs.

The UKHSA is still checking. They want to find out how people got sick. They want to know if the sick people ate the cheeses.

The cheeses that people should not eat are:
* Mrs Kirkham’s Mild & Creamy Lancashire
* Mrs Kirkham’s Tasty Lancashire
* Mrs Kirkham’s Mature Lancashire
* Mrs Kirkham’s Smoked Lancashire
* No 1 Waitrose and Partners, Farmhouse Kirkham’s Lancashire cheese

Amy Douglas works for the agency. She said people who think they are sick should not travel for the holidays.

She said at least 30 people have the same kind of E coli. It is called Stec.

Stec can make you very sick. You might have bad diarrhea. You might have blood in your diarrhea. Your stomach might hurt. You might throw up and have a fever.

If you have diarrhea and throw up, be careful. Do not give it to your family and friends.

text: “Washing your hands with soap and warm water and using bleach-based products to clean surfaces will help stop infections from spreading. Don’t prepare food for others if you have symptoms or for 48 hours after symptoms stop. “Many of us will be travelling for Christmas, but if you are unwell you should avoid visiting people in hospitals and care homes to avoid passing on the infection in these settings. Do not return to work or school once term restarts, until 48 hours after your symptoms have stopped.” A spokesperson for Public Health Scotland said: “PHS can confirm there has been one death associated with E coli O145 in Scotland. We are continuing to monitor the situation in Scotland and are working with UKHSA, who are investigating at a UK-wide level.” A Scottish government spokesperson said: “Our thoughts are with the loved ones of the person who has died. The Scottish government, Food Standards Scotland and Public Health Scotland will continue to do all we can to assist with the ongoing investigations. “We encourage everyone to check the product recall details on the Food Standards Scotland website. Cheeses are sometimes included as part of a hamper, served as individual portions or bought as a gift, so it may not always be clear whether you have purchased an affected product.”
a2_text:
Here is the rewritten text in CEFR A2 English:

It is important to wash your hands. Use soap and warm water. This helps stop infections from spreading. You can also use bleach to clean things.

If you are sick, do not make food for other people. Wait for two days after you feel better. Then you can make food again.

Many people will travel for Christmas. If you are sick, do not visit hospitals or care homes. You can give the infection to other people there.

If you are sick, do not go to work or school. Wait for two days after you feel better. Then you can go back.

Someone from Public Health Scotland said: "We have one death from E coli O145 in Scotland. We are watching the situation. We are working with UKHSA. They are checking things in the UK."

Someone from the Scottish government said: "We are sad about the person who died. We are helping with the checks. This includes the Scottish government, Food Standards Scotland, and Public Health Scotland. We are doing everything we can."

"Please check the list of foods that you should not eat. You can find it on the Food Standards Scotland website. Some cheeses may be bad. These cheeses might be in a gift box, or sold by themselves. So check if you have the bad cheese."

text: The Middle East has been slipping towards the precipice of a regional war ever since the Hamas attack on Israel on 7 October and the ferocious Israeli response in Gaza. The past week has shown how the cliff edge keeping it from that abyss could quickly crumble away. Within hours of the outbreak of the Gaza war, the Hezbollah Shia militia in Lebanon began to fire on northern Israeli towns and villages in solidarity with Palestinians, triggering Israeli air strikes in response, and Houthi forces in Yemen attacked ships in the Red Sea with real or perceived Israeli connections. The US moved two aircraft carriers and their accompanying strike groups to the region as American bases in Syria and Iraq came under repeated attacks from Iran-affiliated groups, drawing swift retaliation from Washington. At the same time the West Bank erupted in protests at the bombing of civilians in Gaza and extremist Jewish settlers quickly sought to ride the wave of Israeli anger by seizing Palestinian land and terrorising its residents. Each of these theatres of conflict has the potential to ignite a much-feared Middle East conflagration, and the past few days have demonstrated just how easily escalation, intended or not, could bring Israel into open confrontation with Iran, and suck in the US too. An Israeli airstrike just outside Damascus killed a senior figure in Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), Sayyed Razi Mousavi, who was responsible for military liaison between Syria and Iran. After Mousavi’s death last Monday, the IRGC issued a statement declaring the “usurper and savage Zionist regime will pay for this crime”. Tehran’s Houthi allies have meanwhile have been firing on the US-led “Prosperity Guardian” naval task force assembled to protect shipping in the Red Sea. American warships shot down dozens of drones and also a handful of ballistic missiles. US Central Command issued a statement to say that Washington had “every reason to believe that these attacks, while launched by the Houthis in Yemen, are fully enabled by Iran”.
a2_text:
After the Hamas attack on Israel on October 7, the Middle East became more dangerous. Israel attacked Gaza very strongly. This made the Middle East close to a big war.

The past week showed that things can get worse very fast.

When the war in Gaza started, Hezbollah in Lebanon started shooting at towns in Israel. They wanted to help the Palestinians. Israel then attacked Lebanon with planes.

Also, the Houthi group in Yemen attacked ships in the Red Sea. They thought the ships were connected to Israel.

The United States sent two big ships to the area. These ships had planes and soldiers. American bases in Syria and Iraq were attacked by groups that work with Iran. The United States then attacked back quickly.

At the same time, people in the West Bank protested. They were angry about the bombing of people in Gaza. Some Jewish people tried to take Palestinian land. They scared the people who lived there.

Each of these problems could start a big war in the Middle East. The past few days showed that it is easy for things to get worse. Israel could fight with Iran. And the United States could get involved too.

Israel attacked a place near Damascus. They killed Sayyed Razi Mousavi. He was a leader from Iran who helped Syria.

After Mousavi died, Iran said they would punish Israel for this. They called Israel a bad name.

The Houthi group in Yemen is friends with Iran. They shot at ships in the Red Sea. These ships are part of a group called "Prosperity Guardian." This group is led by the United States and protects ships.

American ships shot down many drones and missiles. The United States said that Iran helped the Houthi group with these attacks.

text: If a US warship is struck, Joe Biden would be under intense pressure to deliver a decisive response, as he enters an election year with his tenure hanging in the balance and Republicans looking to focus on any trace of weakness. On Thursday, a former Israeli prime minister, Naftali Bennett, wrote a commentary in a US newspaper expressing the view of many on the hawkish end of the security establishments in both the Israel and the US that they are doomed to fight Iranian proxies indefinitely until Iran is taken on directly. “The evil empire of Iran must be brought down,” Bennett argued in the Wall Street Journal. “The US and Israel must set the clear goal of bringing down Iran’s evil regime. Not only is this possible. It is vital for the safety and security of the Middle East – and the entire civilised world.” On Friday, the UN security council convened to discuss violence on the West Bank, but the session was quickly drawn into a discussion of a regional war. The Israeli ambassador, Gilad Erdan, dismissed the issue of settler violence in the West Bank as a distraction from the threat from Hezbollah in Lebanon. “The situation in northern Israel is reaching a point of no return,” Erdan said, echoing an increasingly frequent warning from Israeli officials that their country would take matters into its own hands, possibly by carving out a buffer zone in southern Lebanon. “If these attacks continue, I reiterate the situation will escalate and may lead to a full-scale war. Lebanon must be held accountable for the aggression carried out from its territory,” the Israeli envoy said. Mohamed Khaled Khiari, a UN assistant secretary-general, told security council members that, while most of the exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah had been around the border, some strikes were going deeper into each other’s territory, “raising the spectre of an uncontained conflict with devastating consequences for the people of both countries”. Khiari added that “the risk of miscalculation and further escalation is increasing as the conflict in Gaza continues”.
a2_text:
If a US ship is hit, Joe Biden will have a problem. He will need to react strongly. It is an election year for him. Some people think he is weak. Republicans want to show his weakness.

Naftali Bennett is an ex-leader of Israel. He wrote in a US newspaper. He said many people think like him. They think Israel and the US must fight Iranian groups for a long time. They think they must fight Iran directly.

Bennett said Iran is bad. He said the US and Israel must stop Iran. He said this is important for the Middle East. He said it is important for the world.

On Friday, the UN talked about violence in the West Bank. But they also talked about a bigger war.

Gilad Erdan is Israel's ambassador. He said the West Bank violence is not the main problem. He said Hezbollah in Lebanon is a bigger threat.

Erdan said the situation in north Israel is bad. Israeli leaders say they may act alone. They may make a safe area in south Lebanon.

Erdan said if the attacks keep happening, the situation will get worse. He said it could lead to a big war. He said Lebanon must be responsible for the attacks from its land.

Mohamed Khaled Khiari works for the UN. He told the UN that Israel and Hezbollah are fighting. Some attacks are going far into each other's land. This could cause a big war. It would be very bad for both countries.

Khiari said the fighting in Gaza makes things more dangerous. He said it is easier to make mistakes. He said the situation could get much worse.

text: Lana Nusseibeh, the envoy of the United Arab Emirates, expressed the uneasiness of the Arab world that in the absence of “bold and perhaps uncomfortable decisions” to reverse the drift towards regional conflict, “the alternative is the hellscape of Gaza expanded into the West Bank, Israel, Lebanon, and other parts of the Middle East”. Since the 7 October Hamas attack, the UN estimates that 304 Palestinians have been killed in the West Bank, including 79 children, along with four Israelis, three of them soldiers. Four more Israelis were killed in West Jerusalem in an attack by Palestinian gunmen on 30 November. One of the dead was mistakenly shot by an Israeli soldier. The disproportionate number of Palestinian dead showed that Israeli forces have been conducting an overkill campaign in an effort to deter an uprising in the West Bank in solidarity with Gaza, argued Khaled Elgindy, a senior fellow at the Middle East Institute in Washington. “The Israeli mindset is that they think they are preventing a third Intifada,” Elgindy said. “But I think the way they’re operating, they’re probably more like causing one.” He pointed to the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, as a particularly volatile element in the combustible state of the region. Overwhelmingly blamed by Israelis for the security lapses that allowed the Hamas attack to happen, Netanyahu faces a fall from power, but only when the fighting ends, or at least lessens in intensity. An escalation, on the other hand, could keep him in his post. “It is Netanyahu, frankly, who is dictating the terms on all fronts – in Gaza, on the Lebanon border, across the region – for Netanyahu’s reasons. This is his war,” Elgindy said. He added: “ I think every day that this goes on, you get closer to regional expansion of this whole mess.”
a2_text:
Lana Nusseibeh is from the United Arab Emirates. She talked about the problems in the Middle East. She said the Arab world is worried.

She said that people need to make important decisions. These decisions might be hard. If they don't, the problems will get worse. The problems in Gaza could spread. They could spread to the West Bank, Israel, Lebanon, and other places.

Hamas attacked on October 7. After that, many people died in the West Bank. The UN says that 304 Palestinians died. 79 of them were children. Four Israelis also died. Three of them were soldiers.

On November 30, some Palestinian men attacked in Jerusalem. Four more Israelis died. One person was killed by mistake. An Israeli soldier shot him.

Khaled Elgindy works at the Middle East Institute. He said that many more Palestinians died than Israelis. He thinks Israel is using too much force. He said Israel wants to stop a big fight in the West Bank. This fight would be to help Gaza.

Elgindy thinks Israel's actions are making things worse. He said they might cause a big fight. This fight is called an Intifada.

He said Benjamin Netanyahu is making the region more dangerous. Many Israelis think Netanyahu made mistakes. They think he is the reason Hamas attacked.

Netanyahu might lose his job. But this will only happen when the fighting stops. If the fighting gets worse, he could stay in his job.

Elgindy said Netanyahu is in charge. He is making decisions about Gaza and Lebanon. He is also making decisions for the whole region. Elgindy said this is Netanyahu's war.

Elgindy thinks the problems will spread. He said the region is getting closer to a bigger war every day.

text: A court in South Korea has approved an arrest warrant for the country’s suspended president, Yoon Suk Yeol, who was impeached over his ill-fated decision to impose martial law early this month, investigators said. Yoon’s decision to declare martial law late on 3 December plunged Asia’s fourth-biggest economy into its worst political crisis for decades and caused concern in Washington. Yoon was forced to lift the order just six hours later after MPs forced their way into parliament to vote it down. The corruption investigation office confirmed that a court in Seoul had approved the warrant, but it was not clear if police would be able to execute it. “The arrest warrant and search warrant for President Yoon Suk Yeol … were issued this morning,” the Joint Investigation Headquarters said in a statement. Yoon Kab-keun, a lawyer for Yoon, condemned the move. “The arrest warrant and search and seizure warrant issued at the request of an agency without investigative authority are illegal and invalid,” he said in a statement. Soon after investigators said they had raided the army’s counterintelligence offices as part of the growing martial law probe. “The emergency martial law investigation team of the Corruption Investigation Office is conducting a search and seizure operation at the Counterintelligence Command this afternoon,” investigators said in a statement. Yoon has so far refused to cooperate with the investigation into his martial law order. He has failed to report to investigators for questioning over allegations of abuse of authority and orchestrating a rebellion, and his presidential security service has prevented court-ordered searches of his office and residence. Yoon also faces charges of insurrection – a crime that can carry life imprisonment or the death penalty and one of the few charges from which a South Korean president does not have immunity. An official from the corruption investigation office said Yoon’s refusal to be questioned had prompted the warrant request. “The reason for the warrant is that there is a concern that the individual may refuse to comply with summons without justifiable reasons, and there is sufficient probable cause to suspect the commission of a crime,” the official said. The warrant is valid until 6 January, he said, adding that Yoon could be held at a police station or the Seoul detention centre.
a2_text:
A court in South Korea said yes to arresting the president. The president is Yoon Suk Yeol. He was stopped from working because of a problem.

Investigators said he made a bad decision. He wanted to use the army to control the country. This happened early this month.

Yoon wanted to use the army on December 3. This made the country have a big problem. It was the worst problem in many years. Washington was worried too.

Yoon had to stop using the army after six hours. Members of Parliament went to the parliament. They voted to stop him.

The corruption office said the court agreed to the arrest. But it is not sure if the police can arrest him.

The office said the court gave permission to arrest and search President Yoon. This happened this morning.

Yoon Kab-keun is Yoon's lawyer. He said this is not right. He said the arrest and search are not legal. The office that asked for the arrest does not have the power to do so.

Investigators said they went to the army's office. This is about the problem with using the army.

The investigators are searching the army's office. This is happening this afternoon.

Yoon has not helped with the investigation. He did not go to talk to the investigators. They wanted to ask him about using his power in a wrong way. They also think he started a rebellion. His guards stopped the court from searching his office and home.

Yoon might be charged with rebellion. This is a very bad crime. He could go to prison for life or die. Presidents usually cannot be charged with crimes, but this is one of the few exceptions.

An official said Yoon did not answer questions. This is why they wanted to arrest him.

The official said they think Yoon will not come to talk to them. They think he did something wrong. That is why they want to arrest him.

The arrest warrant is good until January 6. Yoon can be kept at a police station or in jail.

text: Media reports said an imminent arrest or search of the presidential residence was unlikely, as investigators would seek to coordinate with the presidential security service. Technically, anyone obstructing the execution of an arrest warrant could be arrested. But under South Korean law, locations potentially linked to military secrets cannot be seized or searched without the consent of the person in charge, and it is unlikely that Yoon will voluntarily leave his residence if he faces arrest. It is the first time an arrest warrant has been issued for an incumbent president in South Korea, according to local media. Police were deployed early on Tuesday outside Yoon’s residence in central Seoul in an attempt to prevent unrest. Yoon’s supporters and protesters calling for his removal have staked out his residence, with local media showing images of altercations between the two camps overnight. “Unless Yoon voluntarily lets them detain him, there is no way to detain him,” said Choi Jin, director of the Seoul-based Institute of Presidential Leadership. “Should investigators have hand-to-hand fights with the security service?” Choi said that investigators were still likely to visit Yoon’s residence to show they were doing their work diligently and fairly. Park Sung-min, president of the Seoul-based political consulting firm MIN Consulting, said the push for an arrest warrant was probably an attempt to pressure Yoon to cooperate with the investigation. The acting leader of South Korea’s ruling People Power party, Kweon Seong-dong, said on Tuesday that attempting to detain a sitting president was inappropriate, according to Yonhap news agency. Yoon’s presidential powers were suspended after the national assembly voted to impeach him on 14 December over his imposition of martial law. The constitutional court has 180 days from that date to decide whether to confirm the impeachment or reinstate Yoon, whose two-and-a-half years in office have been marred by scandal and policy deadlock. The martial law order triggered weeks of political and market turmoil. Yoon’s replacement, Han Duck-soo, was also impeached last week for refusing to approve bills to facilitate the investigation into his predecessor.
a2_text:
Here is the text rewritten into CEFR A2 level English:

The news says the police will not arrest the president, Yoon, now. They will not search his house yet.

The police want to talk to the president's security guards first. It is against the law to stop the police from doing their job. The police can arrest people who do that.

But, there is a special rule in South Korea. The police cannot search places with military secrets. They need permission first. The person in charge must say it is okay.

President Yoon probably will not leave his house if the police want to arrest him. This is the first time the police want to arrest a president in South Korea.

On Tuesday morning, police went to President Yoon’s house in Seoul. They wanted to stop people from making trouble.

Some people support President Yoon. Other people want him to leave his job. These two groups of people were fighting outside his house last night.

Choi Jin works at a school in Seoul. He said the police cannot arrest President Yoon if he does not want to be arrested. He asked if the police should fight with the security guards.

Choi Jin thinks the police will still visit President Yoon’s house. They want to show they are doing their job well.

Park Sung-min works for a company in Seoul. He thinks the police want to arrest President Yoon to make him help with the investigation.

Kweon Seong-dong is a leader of a political party. He said it is not right to arrest a president who is still working.

The government stopped President Yoon from working on December 14. They voted to impeach him because he used martial law.

Now, the court has 180 days to decide. They will decide if President Yoon must leave his job or if he can come back.

President Yoon has been president for two and a half years. There have been problems and scandals during that time.

The martial law caused problems for weeks.

Han Duck-soo is now the president. Last week, the government also voted to impeach him. This is because he did not approve some papers about the investigation of President Yoon.

text: Han’s successor as interim president, Choi Sang-mok, had been in office for just two days when he was confronted with the fatal plane crash at Muan international airport, the worst aviation disaster on South Korean soil. On Tuesday Choi called for national harmony and unity and for trust in the government in a New Year’s address. “The Republic of Korea is in an unprecedentedly serious situation,” Choi said in a written statement, citing changes around global trade, diplomacy and security, as well as domestic political uncertainty. “The government will do its best to run state affairs stably in all areas of defence, diplomacy, economy and society for the people to feel relieved,” he added. Agencies contributed reporting
a2_text:
Here is the text rewritten in CEFR A2 level English:

Choi Sang-mok is the new leader now. He is taking over from Han. He started the job two days ago.

Then, a plane crashed at Muan airport. It was a very bad accident. Many people died. It was the worst plane crash in South Korea.

On Tuesday, Choi spoke to the country. It was New Year. He said we need to be friends and work together. He said we need to trust the government.

Choi said South Korea is in a difficult time. He said things are changing in the world. This includes trade, talking to other countries, and keeping safe. He also said there are problems with the government in South Korea.

Choi said the government will work hard. They will keep the country safe. They will work on the economy. They will help people feel safe and happy.

text: In the wake of the April 2019 fire that devastated Notre Dame, the French president Emmanuel Macron promised that the monument would be rebuilt with a “contemporary gesture”. There followed all manner of madcap ideas: a glass spire; a 300ft carbon-fibre flame; a swimming pool on the roof; a covered garden. In the end, Notre Dame was restored to its original former glory and ceremonially reopened this month. Now, however, the planned “contemporary gesture” has been revealed – and has sparked a bitter row. The French artist Claire Tabouret has been chosen to design new stained glass windows depicting Pentecostal scenes, to be installed in the chapels on the south side of the medieval church. Tabouret was among 100 artists who took part in a competition to replace the existing six windows installed by architect Eugène Viollet-le-Duc in 1844 – even though the windows were not damaged in the 2019 fire. Designs submitted by Tabouret, 43, a figurative artist whose work featured in the Vatican pavilion at the Venice Biennale this year and who now lives in Los Angeles, show scenes of people in prayer in shades of red, turquoise, yellow and pink. She will work with master glassmakers at the Atelier Simon-Marq, a glass workshop founded in Reims in 1640, to recreate the drawings in glass. The plan to replace the 19th-century chapel windows, which feature geometric designs described as having more historic than aesthetic value, has enraged critics. The 1964 Venice Charter, which codifies guidelines for preserving French buildings, states: “Items of sculpture, painting or decoration which form an integral part of a monument may only be removed if this is the sole means of ensuring their preservation,” and that “the valid contributions of all periods to the building of a monument must be respected”. In July, the national committee for heritage and architecture at France’s ministry of culture unanimously opposed the plan to remove Viollet-le-Duc’s windows, prompting one artist to withdraw his designs from the competition. The Académie des Beaux-Arts has also opposed the replacing of the windows.
a2_text:
In April 2019, there was a big fire at Notre Dame. Notre Dame is a very important church in France. The fire hurt the church a lot.

The French president, Emmanuel Macron, said he would rebuild the church. He wanted to add something new and modern. People had many strange ideas. Someone said to build a glass tower. Another idea was a very tall flame made of special material. Someone even wanted a swimming pool on the roof!

In the end, they fixed Notre Dame to look like it did before. It opened again this month. But now, we know what the new, modern thing will be. It is making many people angry.

A French artist named Claire Tabouret will design new windows. These windows will show pictures about Pentecost. Pentecost is a religious event. The windows will go in the small rooms on the south side of the church.

Many artists joined a contest. They wanted to make new windows. Claire Tabouret was one of them. She will change six old windows. These windows were put in by an architect, Eugène Viollet-le-Duc, in 1844. These old windows were not hurt in the fire.

Claire Tabouret is 43 years old. She makes art with people in it. Her art was in a show in Venice this year. Now, she lives in Los Angeles. Her window designs show people praying. The colors are red, blue, yellow, and pink.

She will work with glass experts. They work at a place called Atelier Simon-Marq. This workshop is very old. It started in 1640. They will make her drawings into real glass windows.

Some people are angry about changing the old windows. The old windows have shapes on them. People say they are important for history, but not very beautiful.

There are rules for taking care of old buildings in France. These rules say you can only remove art if you need to protect it. The rules also say we should respect things that were added to the building at different times.

In July, a group of experts said no to changing the windows. They all agreed that the old windows should stay. One artist even stopped being in the contest because of this. The Académie des Beaux-Arts also does not want to change the windows.

text: In a statement last year, it wrote: “[The members of the academy] are concerned that the announcement of a competition for the creation of contemporary stained glass windows, which they support in principle, involves replacing the non-figurative windows ... The fire spared these windows. “The Académie des Beaux-Arts hopes that other locations, starting with the North Tower, will be considered for this commission for contemporary stained glass.” However, the plan, expected to cost more than €4m (£3.3m), has the approval of the president, the archbishop of Paris, Laurent Ulrich, and the church authorities. At a press conference after the announcement of her selection, Tabouret, a graduate of Paris’s prestigious École Nationale Supérieure des Beaux-Arts, said she was “excited” by the challenge but aware of the controversy. “I’ve read about the different opinions of people because I want to understand their arguments and also to take an approach that is open and two-way. I find it a fascinating debate,” she said. She wanted to create stained glass windows that would have “the right presence … without imposing themselves on visitors”. Didier Rykner, a French journalist, art historian and founder of La Tribune de l’Art, a magazine dedicated to preserving France’s heritage, has described the idea of replacing the windows as “totally ludicrous”. He has launched a petition against the plan that has almost 250,000 signatures. “The president of the republic has decided on his own, without any regard for the heritage law or Notre Dame cathedral in Paris, to replace the stained glass windows in six out of the seven chapels on the south aisle with contemporary creations, after organising a competition,” it reads. “The stained glass windows in Notre Dame designed by Viollet-le-Duc were created as a coherent whole. It is a genuine creation that the architect wanted to be faithful to the cathedral’s gothic origins. Who gave the head of state a mandate to alter a cathedral that does not belong to him, but to everyone? “Emmanuel Macron wants to put the stamp of the 21st century on Notre Dame de Paris.
a2_text:
The Academy said something last year. The members are worried. They support the idea of new, modern windows. But they do not want to remove the old windows.

The old windows are not pictures of people. The fire did not hurt these windows. The Academy wants the new windows in a different place. Maybe in the North Tower.

The plan will cost a lot of money. It will cost more than 4 million euros. The president, the archbishop, and the church like the plan.

A woman named Tabouret will make the windows. She went to a famous art school in Paris. She is happy about the work. But she knows some people do not like the idea.

Tabouret said she knows about the different opinions. She wants to understand what people think. She wants to talk to people about it. She wants to make windows that are good. They should not be too strong for people to see.

Didier Rykner is a journalist and art expert. He thinks it is a bad idea to change the windows. He started a paper people can sign to say no. Almost 250,000 people have signed it.

Rykner said the president decided by himself. He did not think about the rules about old buildings. He wants to change the windows in six chapels. He wants to put new, modern windows there.

The old windows were made by Viollet-le-Duc. He made them to fit the cathedral. He wanted the windows to be like the old Gothic style. Rykner asks who told the president he could change the cathedral. The cathedral belongs to everyone, not just the president.

Emmanuel Macron wants to show that Notre Dame is from the 21st century.

text: Perhaps a little modesty would be preferable.” The French heritage association Sites & Monuments has threatened legal action if the plan to remove Viollet-le-Duc’s windows goes ahead. Rykner told the Observer: “To remove windows that survived the fire undamaged and replace them with others is just absurd. I am not against contemporary windows per se but there is just no reason to replace these windows. Besides, money donated by people to renovate Notre Dame has already been spent on cleaning them. “It’s absolutely ridiculous. We’ve been told they will put the Viollet-le-Duc windows on display in a museum. They don’t belong in a museum – they belong in Notre Dame. It makes no sense for them to be on display anywhere other than the cathedral. Their only interest is in situ.” He added: “I don’t see why Macron has such a say over what happens to a heritage building. This is just a vanity project. “As for the church authorities approving this – we should remember that the greatest vandalism done to French churches and religious buildings in the 60s and 70s was carried out … by the church. They have no taste.” Stéphane Bern, Macron’s former heritage tsar, voiced his opposition to the plan in an interview with Ouest France newspaper. “I have nothing against Claire Tabouret or contemporary stained glass ... But I am in favour of them when the old ones are destroyed or damaged. You can’t remove stained glass windows that are listed as historic monuments,” Bern said. “Why does the state set itself free from the rules it imposes on others? Just because the president wants it that way?” Simon-Marq will make the six new windows, which will reach 7m high and cover a total surface area of 121 sq metres, and are expected to be installed in 2026. Tabouret said she would be incorporating motifs from Viollet-le-Duc’s windows in the stained glass.
a2_text:
The group "Sites & Monuments" is angry. They don't want the old windows of Notre Dame to be taken out. The windows were made by Viollet-le-Duc.

Mr. Rykner said it is silly to remove the good windows. He wants to keep them. He said the money to fix Notre Dame was already used to clean the old windows.

Mr. Rykner said the old windows should stay in Notre Dame. He does not want them in a museum. He thinks they belong in the church.

He also said that President Macron should not decide what happens to the old building. He thinks Macron only wants to change the windows to show off.

Mr. Rykner said the church leaders have made bad choices before. He said they do not have good taste.

Mr. Stéphane Bern also does not like the plan. He used to work with Macron on old buildings.

Mr. Bern said new windows are okay if the old ones are broken. But the old windows are not broken. He said you cannot remove old windows that are important.

He asks why the government can break its own rules. He thinks it is only because the president wants it.

Ms. Simon-Marq will make the new windows. They will be very big. They will be put in place in 2026.

Ms. Tabouret said the new windows will look like the old windows. She will use some of the same ideas.

text: I was drawn to Jonathan Freedland’s article (‘How do we live in this terrible world?’ a reader asked me. Here’s the only answer I have, 20 December), as it is a question that’s continually on my mind. There’s much substance in his well-informed piece, though the ending’s quite simple and resonates with my own take: “Perhaps by accepting that it’s the only one we have and that it’s not always so terrible – that sometimes, even quite often, it can be rather beautiful.” One of my responses to this ever-present question is to have gratitude for what I call “magic moments” in nature – like this morning catching sight of the heron, almost invisible, being so amazingly camouflaged among the reeds by a stream; I said “good morning, heron” softly, but didn’t linger because I’ve come to realise that they don’t like being looked at for long. A few years ago, I made a book of Marvellous Mundane Magic for my then 10-year-old granddaughter, to demonstrate to her that magic wasn’t solely the property of wizards. She loved it and now she’s noting her own and giving them to me to make a new book. Even a short early-morning walk offers magic if your eyes and ears are open, even if it’s just hearing a winter robin or seeing herb robert still flowering by a path. Margaret Turner Exeter • Jonathan Freedland gave us “a few reasons to be hopeful” about living in this terrible world. Thank you – they are good reasons: drawing strength from those who “dare to swim against even the bleakest tides”, celebrating what is good, and remembering that this is the only world we have, and that it is often beautiful. These reasons all involve looking outwards, observing. A complementary way of being hopeful – and happy – is looking inwards and acting on our values. Alone, or with the help of activist citizen groups. Thinking back, that is what the suffragettes did, the anti-apartheid activists and many others who have made the world a better place.
a2_text:
I read an article by Jonathan Freedland. He asked: "How do we live in this terrible world?" I think about this question a lot.

His article was good. He said something simple. He said the world is the only one we have. He said it is not always terrible. Sometimes it is beautiful. I agree with him.

I try to be thankful for "magic moments" in nature. This morning, I saw a heron. It was hard to see because it looked like the reeds by the stream. I said, "Good morning, heron." I did not stay long. Herons do not like to be watched.

A few years ago, I made a book for my granddaughter. She was ten years old. The book was about "Marvellous Mundane Magic." I wanted to show her that magic is not just for wizards. She liked the book. Now she writes down her own magic moments. She gives them to me. I will make a new book.

Even a short walk can have magic. You just need to look and listen. You might hear a robin in winter. You might see a flower by the path.

Margaret Turner wrote about Jonathan Freedland's article. He gave us reasons to be hopeful. The world is terrible, but we can still hope. We can get strength from people who fight for what is right. We can be happy about good things. We can remember that this is our only world. It is often beautiful.

We can look outside and see these things. We can also look inside ourselves. We can act on what we believe is right. We can do it alone or with others. People who fought for women's rights did this. People who fought against apartheid did this too. They made the world better.

text: Our thanks to them for doing more than observing. And happy new year to all. Patrick and Alison Duncan Norton, North Yorkshire • The most important component of staying optimistic in these troubled times is positive action. When we look at the world in despair, we should ask ourselves: “What can I do to improve it?” The only way the world gets better is through lots of people showing more love, empathy and care. Especially at Christmas, there are ample opportunities to make a difference to someone’s life. A donation to a charity, a kind word to a stranger, a Christmas card sent to a neighbour. Picking up rubbish, volunteering, donating to a food bank. It might not be much as a single deed, but imagine 9 billion little actions. Wow! Here’s to a better future for all. Hanna Pennig Forglen, Aberdeenshire • I cannot hope – but I can, and do, take it one day at a time. Being in the now opens me up to the small joys that everyday life offers. A toddler on the bus who smiles at me; a dog waiting patiently outside a supermarket; a sunny day. I have no agency to change the big things, but I am in control of how I respond to them. Lyn Dade Twickenham, London • Jonathan Freedland is helpful and encouraging in his reply to the question: “How do we live in this terrible world?” My own way of struggling with terrible news is to remind myself that wherever there is suffering, even of great magnitude, there are wonderful people struggling to alleviate it. The work they do and the sacrifices they make lift up our hearts and spirits. The annual Guardian and Observer charity appeal helps and encourages us to support such people not only at Christmas, but throughout the year. Peter B Godfrey Life president, The Send a Child to Hucklow Fund • Do you have a photograph you’d like to share with Guardian readers? If so, please click here to upload it. A selection will be published in our Readers’ best photographs galleries and in the print edition on Saturdays.
a2_text:
Thank you to Patrick and Alison Duncan Norton. They do more than watch. Happy New Year to everyone! They are from North Yorkshire.

Hanna Pennig says we should do things to be happy. It is hard now. We can ask ourselves, "What can I do to help?" The world is better when people are kind. We can show love and care.

Christmas is a good time to help. We can give money to a charity. We can say kind words to people. We can send a card to a neighbor. We can pick up trash. We can help people for free. We can give food to a food bank.

One small thing can help. If many people do small things, it will be great. Nine billion small things! Let's hope for a better future. Hanna is from Aberdeenshire.

Lyn Dade says she takes things one day at a time. She lives in the moment. This makes her happy. She sees small happy things. A baby smiles at her on the bus. A dog waits outside a shop. The sun is shining.

Lyn cannot change big problems. But she can change how she feels about them. Lyn is from London.

Peter B Godfrey says Jonathan Freedland helps him. Jonathan answers the question: "How do we live in this bad world?"

Peter feels bad news is hard. But he remembers good people are helping. They help people who are sad. They work hard and give things up. This makes our hearts feel better.

The Guardian and Observer charity helps these good people. We can help them at Christmas. We can help them all year. Peter is from The Send a Child to Hucklow Fund.

Do you want to show a picture? Click here to send it. We will put some pictures in the newspaper and online.

text: As families in Taiwan prepare to gather for lunar new year celebrations in January, a game that will be released that month promises to offer some war-themed fun over the festive period. The board game 2045, developed by the Taiwanese company Mizo Games, invites players to participate in an imaginary Chinese invasion 20 years in the future. Players are given roles that include Taiwanese army officers, Chinese sleeper agents and volunteer citizen fighters. “We can’t predict the future, but if a conflict is unavoidable I hope this game gives people a chance to experience war on the tabletop before it reaches us,” KJ Chang, the founder of Mizo Games, told the Wall Street Journal. The game is being released at a time when China has increased its military pressure around the self-governing island. Taiwan has never been ruled by the People’s Republic of China but Beijing regards it as part of its territory and has promised to “unify” it with China, using force if necessary. Observers do not know when, if ever, China will launch a military operation against Taiwan. But some analysts have pointed to the years around 2050 as a possible risk period. Xi Jinping, China’s leader and military commander-in-chief, has pledged to build a “world-class army” by the middle of the century, and 2049, the centenary of the People’s Republic of China, is the date by which Beijing wants to achieve “national rejuvenation”. Mizo Games launched a crowdfunding campaign for their new product in August. Within months, it had raised NTD$4.1m (£99,468), surpassing its original target by more than 4,000%. 2045 is the latest in a series of entertainment products in Taiwan that focus on the threat of an attempted Chinese annexation. This year also saw the release of Zero Day, a Taiwanese government-funded television series that depicts a Chinese invasion. It also received support from Robert Tsao, a Taiwanese tech billionaire and supporter of Taiwan’s civil defence efforts. As well as receiving the first copies of the game, VIP backers of the crowdfunding campaign will receive extra Taiwan-themed products.
a2_text:
In January, families in Taiwan will celebrate Lunar New Year. A new game will also come out in January. The game is called "2045".

The game is about a war. It is about a possible attack from China in the future. The game is made by a company in Taiwan called Mizo Games.

In the game, players can be different people. They can be soldiers from Taiwan. They can be spies from China. They can also be citizens who are fighting.

KJ Chang is the person who started Mizo Games. He said the game lets people think about war. He hopes people can learn about war in a safe way.

China is putting more pressure on Taiwan. Taiwan is an island. It has its own government. But China thinks Taiwan is part of China. China wants to take over Taiwan, maybe with force.

No one knows when China might attack Taiwan. Some people think it could happen around the year 2050.

The leader of China, Xi Jinping, wants a very strong army. He wants it by the middle of the century. China will be 100 years old in 2049. China wants to be strong again by then.

Mizo Games asked people for money to make the game. They got a lot of money very fast. They got much more money than they asked for.

"2045" is not the only thing in Taiwan about a possible attack. There is also a TV show called "Zero Day". It is also about an attack from China. The government of Taiwan helped to pay for the show.

A rich man named Robert Tsao also supports Taiwan. He helped with the TV show. People who gave a lot of money to the game will get special gifts. The gifts are about Taiwan.

text: They include a leather passport cover embossed with the words: “Let my fly as a Taiwanese”, a nod to Taiwan’s lack of international recognition. Most countries in the world only have formal diplomatic relations with China. Beijing insists that countries should not recognise Taiwan as a separate country from China and puts pressure on governments to cut ties with Taipei.
a2_text:
Here is the rewritten text at CEFR A2 level:

There is a passport cover. It is made of leather. It has words on it. The words say: “Let my fly as a Taiwanese.” This is about Taiwan. Many countries do not know Taiwan. They only talk to China. China says Taiwan is part of China. China does not want countries to see Taiwan as a different country. China tells countries to stop talking to Taiwan.

text: The tech entrepreneur and close adviser to Donald Trump Elon Musk has taken a stunning new public step in his support for the far-right German political party Alternative for Germany (AfD), publishing a supportive guest opinion piece for the country’s Welt am Sonntag newspaper that has prompted the commentary editor to resign in protest. The commentary piece in German was launched online on Saturday before being published on Sunday in the flagship paper of the Axel Springer media group, which also owns the US politics news site Politico. Musk uses populist and personal language to try to deny AfD’s extremist bent, and the essay expands on his post on his social media platform, X, on which he last week claimed that “only the AfD can save Germany”. Translated, Musk’s piece said: “The portrayal of the AfD as rightwing extremist is clearly false, considering that Alice Weidel, the party’s leader, has a same-sex partner from Sri Lanka! Does that sound like Hitler to you? Please!” Germany’s domestic intelligence agency has classified the AfD at the national level as a suspected extremism case since 2021. Shortly after the piece was published online, the editor of the opinion section, Eva Marie Kogel, used the US tech mogul’s own platform to post on X that she had submitted her resignation. “I always enjoyed heading the opinion department at Welt and Wams. Today a text by Elon Musk appeared in Welt am Sonntag. Yesterday I submitted my resignation after printing,” she posted. She included a link to the Musk commentary article. The AfD has a strong anti-immigration stance and, like incoming president Donald Trump in relation to the US, is calling for mass deportations from Germany. Earlier in December, Musk not only posted in favor of AfD but the party’s hard line on immigration appeared to resonate with the incoming US vice-president, JD Vance, MSNBC reported. Senior Welt Group figures weighed in on Saturday. “Democracy and journalism thrive on freedom of expression.
a2_text:
Elon Musk is a businessman. He is a friend of Donald Trump.

Musk is now helping a political party in Germany. The party is called AfD. Some people think AfD is very far-right.

Musk wrote an article for a German newspaper called Welt am Sonntag. The article was about AfD. The editor of the newspaper's opinion section did not like it. She quit her job because of the article.

The newspaper belongs to a company. This company also owns a news website called Politico.

In the article, Musk said AfD is not extreme. He said the leader of AfD, Alice Weidel, has a partner who is a woman from Sri Lanka. He asked if this sounds like Hitler.

But Germany's government thinks AfD might be extremist. They have been watching the party since 2021.

The editor who quit posted about it on X, which is Musk's social media platform. She said she liked her job. But she resigned after Musk's article was printed. She shared a link to the article.

AfD does not want many immigrants in Germany. Like Donald Trump, they want to send people out of the country.

In December, Musk said he liked AfD. JD Vance, who will be the Vice-President of the US, seemed to agree with AfD's ideas about immigration.

People at the newspaper company talked about the article. They said it is important to have freedom of speech.

text: This includes dealing with polarising positions and classifying them journalistically,” the newspaper’s editor-in-chief designate, Jan Philipp Burgard, and Ulf Poschardt, who takes over as publisher on 1 January, told Reuters. They said discussion about Musk’s piece, which had about 340 comments several hours after it was published, was “very revealing”. Underneath Musk’s commentary, the newspaper published a response by Burgard. “Musk’s diagnosis is correct, but his therapeutic approach, that only the AfD can save Germany, is fatally false,” he wrote, referencing the AfD’s desire to leave the European Union and seek rapprochement with Russia as well as appease China. Musk and Weidel both later posted a link to the article on X. The AfD backing from Musk, who also defended his right to weigh in on German politics due to his “significant investments”, comes as Germans are set to vote on 23 February after a coalition government led by the German chancellor, Olaf Scholz, collapsed late this fall. The AfD is running second in opinion polls and might be able to thwart either a centre-right or centre-left majority, but Germany’s mainstream, more centrist parties have pledged to shun any support from the AfD at the national level.
a2_text:
Here is the text rewritten for CEFR A2 level:

The new editor, Jan Philipp Burgard, and the new publisher, Ulf Poschardt, talked to Reuters. They said they need to write about different opinions. They need to write about them like a journalist.

They talked about Elon Musk's article. People wrote about 340 comments on it. They said the comments were "very interesting."

The newspaper also wrote a reply to Musk's article. Burgard wrote the reply. He said Musk is right about some problems. But he said Musk is wrong about the solution. Musk thinks only the AfD party can help Germany. Burgard said this is not right.

The AfD wants to leave the European Union. They want to be friends with Russia. They also want to please China.

Musk and Weidel shared a link to the article on X.

Musk supports the AfD. He said he can talk about German politics. This is because he has "big investments" in Germany.

Germans will vote on February 23. The government of Olaf Scholz fell apart. This happened late in the year.

The AfD is doing well in the polls. They might stop the other parties from winning. The other parties do not want help from the AfD. The other parties are more in the middle.

text: Dominique Pelicot will not appeal against his conviction for drugging and raping his wife and inviting strangers to rape her, his lawyer has said. Béatrice Zavarro said the former electrician, 72, who was jailed for the maximum 20 years this month, wished to spare his now ex-wife, Gisèle Pelicot, a new ordeal but admitted there was also the risk a new trial in front of a public jury could mean a longer prison sentence. Pelicot and the 50 others who were all found guilty of rape or sexual assault after a three-and-a-half-month trial have until midnight on Monday to lodge an appeal. A statement from public prosecutor confirmed that 17 people had so far appealed against their convictions, adding that a new trial would be held in Nîmes towards the end of next year. Gisèle Pelicot, 72, a retired logistics manager, believes she may have been raped more than 200 times by her husband and other men between 2011 and 2020, when Dominique Pelicot was finally caught after filming up the skirts of female shoppers in a supermarket near the couple’s home in the Provençal town of Mazan. Detectives subsequently found tens of thousands of videos of the abuse on his phone and a hard drive. On Monday, Zavarro said Dominique Pelicot had decided not to appeal against his conviction because to do so would “force Gisèle into a new ordeal and new confrontations, which [he] rejects”. Appealing against the guilty judgment, when Pelicot admitted the charges, would involve “running an unnecessary risk”, she added, as the accusations could be made more serious in the appeal court, where the case would be held in front of a public jury, potentially leading to a longer prison term. “It is time to put an end to this judicially,” Zavarro said on Monday. The marathon rape trial in Avignon was heard by a panel of five professional magistrates. The appeal court, which sits in the southern city of Nîmes, will require a new full trial within the next year. Gisèle Pelicot is not required to attend the appeal hearing but her lawyer, Stéphane Babonneau, indicated she was ready to do so.
a2_text:
Dominique Pelicot was in court. He was found guilty of a bad crime. He gave his wife drugs. He made strangers hurt her.

His lawyer, Béatrice Zavarro, spoke about it. Dominique is 72 years old. He used to be an electrician. He will stay in jail for 20 years. This is the longest time he could stay in jail.

Dominique will not ask for another trial. He does not want to hurt his ex-wife, Gisèle Pelicot, again. It would be hard for her. Also, a new trial could mean he stays in jail longer.

Dominique and 50 other people were found guilty. They did bad things to women. They had until Monday to ask for a new trial.

The police said that 17 people asked for a new trial. The new trial will be in Nîmes next year.

Gisèle Pelicot is 72 years old. She used to be a manager. She thinks she was hurt many times between 2011 and 2020. Her husband and other men hurt her.

Dominique was caught in 2020. He was taking videos of women in a shop. The shop was near their home in Mazan.

The police found many videos on his phone. The videos showed him hurting women.

On Monday, Béatrice Zavarro said Dominique will not ask for a new trial. He does not want Gisèle to go through more pain. He does not want her to see him in court again.

Dominique said he did the bad things. A new trial could make things worse for him. The court could give him a longer time in jail.

Béatrice Zavarro said it is time for the case to end.

The first trial was long. It was in Avignon. Five judges listened to the case.

If there is a new trial, it will be in Nîmes. It will happen next year.

Gisèle Pelicot does not have to go to the new trial. But her lawyer, Stéphane Babonneau, said she is ready to go if she needs to.

text: “She has told us she will be there. Maybe not every day but she says she will go,” he said. She became an international feminist figurehead after insisting the trial be held in open court and the videos of her abuse shown in order that “shame changes sides”. The trial has caused much soul-searcing in France and calls to tighten French rape laws, including introducing the concept of “consent”, which is absent. The trial also threw a spotlight on attitudes towards the rape and sexual abuse of women in France, where 94% of reported rape cases are dropped without any action. “From Gisèle Pelicot’s point of view, there is no sentence that will give her back what she has lost,” Babonneau said. “All Gisèle Pelicot wanted is to have the accused convicted for what they did to her. As for the personal sentences, she respects the decision of the court and finds no solace in them.”
a2_text:
Here is the rewritten text at CEFR A2 level:

He said, "She told us she will come. Maybe not every day. But she said she will go there."

She is now famous all over the world for women's rights. This happened after her trial. She wanted the trial to be open. Everyone could see it. She also wanted the videos of what happened to her to be shown. She said this would make the people who hurt her feel ashamed.

The trial made many people in France think hard. They want to make the rape laws in France stronger. They want to add the idea of "consent" to the laws. Consent means saying "yes." Right now, the laws do not talk about consent.

The trial showed how people in France think about rape and hurting women. Many rape cases are dropped. This means that the police do not do anything about them. 94 out of 100 rape cases are dropped.

Babonneau said, "Gisèle Pelicot will never get back what she lost. No punishment can fix that."

He also said, "Gisèle Pelicot wanted one thing. She wanted the people who hurt her to be found guilty. She is okay with what the court decided. It does not make her happy, but she accepts it."

text: Work has begun to conserve and digitise one of the oldest paper documents still in existence on the island of Ireland. The ecclesiastical register, which dates back to the medieval period, is about 650 years old. It belonged to the former archbishop of Armagh Milo Sweteman. Its delicate pages are being repaired by experts at the Public Records Office of Northern Ireland (Proni) as part of an initiative to rejuvenate and preserve some of the island of Ireland’s most important historical texts. Ecclesiastical registers contain copies or drafts of documents created by the archbishops’ administration work, including legal papers, official letters, correspondence, receipts and wills. The register belonging to Sweteman dates to his time in the senior clerical role from 1361 to 1380. Conservation work on the register of archbishop John Swayne, dated from 1418 to 1438, has already been completed and a digitised copy, along with a translated summary, are now available online. The conservation work on the Swayne books involved carefully detaching bindings dating from the 17th century, gently washing all the paper folios and then consolidating each piece of paper with a weak gelatine solution. Tears and losses in the paper were infilled with Japanese kozo paper before the books were rebound using 17th-century binding material. The work now under way on the Sweteman register involves the need to repair damage that resulted from previous conservation efforts dating back to the start of the 20th century when tracing paper was placed on the pages in an attempt to preserve them. The tracing paper was acidic and actually accelerated the corrosion of the ink and paper. It is now being removed using a specialist gel before being subjected to a low-pressure washing process. The same kozo paper and wheat starch paste repairs used for Swayne’s register are then being undertaken. Similar work is being carried out on a third register, dated between 1400 and 1418, that belonged to former archbishop Nicholas Fleming. Sarah Graham, head of conservation at Proni, explained that paper was extremely rare on the island of Ireland when the registers were compiled.
a2_text:
Here is the text rewritten in CEFR A2 level English:

Old papers are being taken care of. These papers are from Ireland. They are very, very old.

One of the oldest paper documents is being fixed. This document is about 650 years old. It is a church book.

The book belonged to a man named Milo Sweteman. He was an important church leader. He was the archbishop of Armagh.

Experts are fixing the book. They work at the Public Records Office. This place is called Proni.

Proni wants to keep old and important papers safe. This is why they are fixing the book.

Church books like this have copies of old papers. These papers were made by the archbishop. They are about laws, letters, and money. They also have old wills.

Sweteman's book is from when he was archbishop. That was from 1361 to 1380.

Another old book has already been fixed. It belonged to archbishop John Swayne. His book is from 1418 to 1438. You can see a copy of his book online. There is also a simple explanation of what it says.

To fix Swayne's book, they took it apart. They washed the paper very carefully. Then, they made the paper stronger. They used a special glue.

If the paper was torn, they used special paper to fix it. Then, they put the book back together. They used old materials from the 1600s.

Now, they are fixing Sweteman's book. It was damaged a long time ago. People tried to fix it before.

They used special paper to protect it. But the paper was bad. It made the book worse.

Now, they are taking off the bad paper. They use a special gel. Then, they wash the book.

They will use the same paper and glue to fix it. They used this for Swayne's book.

They are also fixing another old book. It belonged to archbishop Nicholas Fleming. It is from 1400 to 1418.

Sarah Graham works at Proni. She is in charge of fixing old papers. She said that paper was hard to find in Ireland a long time ago. That is when these books were written.

text: It was a period that just predated the invention of the printing press when parchment from animal skins was still the preferred writing material. “Paper that pre-dates 1450 is particularly rare, it didn’t occur in Ireland for a couple of centuries after the register of Milo Sweteman or the register of John Swayne were completed,” said Graham. “We’ve done some research into the watermarks and know that the paper came from Italy and from Spain.” Graham said it was likely the archbishops imported the paper to Ireland during their travels around Europe. The Virtual Record Treasury of Ireland is an effort to partially recreate the rich historical archive that was destroyed when the Public Record Office of Ireland in Dublin was set alight in June 1922 in the beginning of the Irish civil war. Graham emphasised the importance of preserving the centuries-old documents that do still exist. “The work that we do in conservation more broadly is really important to stabilise the collections so that they’re available to the public now, but they’re also available for generations to come, so that future generations are able to understand where they come from, what their history is, and the primary source of material is here and available to them,” she said.
a2_text:
Here is the text rewritten in CEFR A2 level English:

A long time ago, people did not have printing presses. They wrote on animal skins. This was before the year 1450.

Graham said paper from before 1450 is very special. It was not in Ireland for a long time. This was after two books were made. The books were called "Register of Milo Sweteman" and "Register of John Swayne."

Graham studied the paper. She looked at the watermarks. Watermarks are like small pictures in the paper. She learned the paper came from Italy and Spain.

Graham thinks the archbishops brought the paper to Ireland. They traveled around Europe. They probably bought the paper there.

The Virtual Record Treasury of Ireland is a project. It tries to make a copy of old papers. These papers were lost in a fire. The fire was in Dublin in 1922. It was at the Public Record Office of Ireland. The fire happened at the start of the Irish civil war.

Graham said it is important to keep the old papers safe. These papers are hundreds of years old.

She said that her work is important. They keep the papers in good condition. Then people can see them now. Future people can also see them later. They can learn about their history. The papers are important sources of information. They can see them and learn.

text: South Korea’s intelligence agency has reported that a North Korean soldier believed to have been the first to be captured while supporting Russia’s war in Ukraine has died after being taken alive by Ukrainian forces.
